name: socioculturally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is related to the different groups of people in society and their habits, traditions, and beliefs: The show is geared toward a generally young and socioculturally diverse audience. The students were all very socioculturally and politically aware. Clinical assessments should always be made in a socio-culturally sensitive manner.
More examplesFewer examplesWe need to approach the situation in a socioculturally sensitive way.Some socioculturally influenced words or expressions take the form of idioms.The two sets of patients were chosen so as to represent two socioculturally different groups.
